reviews.text: We stayed in a Cabana room and standard (deluxe) room over new year.
reviews.title: Busy, but good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was busy, as you might expect, but still managed generally to maintain the high Four Seasons standards.
reviews.title: It's the Four Seasons!

reviews.text: The hotel was full, and we arrived early in the morning (9am) well before check in time, yet they still managed to get one room ready for us on arrival, and the other shortly afterwards.
reviews.title: Quiet luxury in a good location to see Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well position for shopping, and sky train, but is some way away from the river. Some might prefer to be in the centre of things, but if you want some respite from the tourist trail, this would be an excellent location.
reviews.title: If you want luxury, then there's no better place to be!

reviews.text: The restaurants are all good, we can particularly recommend Shintaro the Japanese restaurant.
reviews.title: Ageing - gracefully with exceptional service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is perfectly located for shopping. The size is quite large so for groups and business it is also good. There are 4 restaurants, which are very good with great service. Throughout the hotel, the service is what you would expect from a Four Seasons. The fitness center is above average and the spa is outstanding!. Overall a great experience. The only downside is the hotel is a bit old and needs an overhaul. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Four Seasons Bangkok
The best hotel I have stayed at in last few years!!
reviews.text: We stayed on the executive floor of the hotel and this was probably the best hotel experience we have had for many years. All the staff were fantastic and only too willing to go that extra bit to help. The girls on the executive floor were especially willing and able to help us on everything we needed. The breakfasts and evening canapes/drinks were especially well done and interesting. The bedrooms were always clean and tidy and little extras from the hotel were appreciated. When we left they even provided little plastic bags for the airport security checks! I would strongly urge you to pay the extra and stay on the executive floor. For a Four Seasons this hotel is also extremely good value for money. We ate in all the restaurants the Italian "Biscotti "really good original food and a very competent and effective manager the same kind of excellent manager is also in the steak restaurant "Madison" again great food this time based on meat/

steaks. The Thai restaurant is OK but not great (maybe bit too westernized food!!). My only complaint the price of wine but there again its the Govt duty not the hotel profits. We staryed for almost 2 weeks having extended from a week. Very relaxing and after a day in the Bangkok heat and humidity it was great to get into their pool and have a few beers or a drink in the lounge. All in all this is the best hotel stay for many years.
reviews.title: An oasis in Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent place. Unfortunately I only stayed one night, but would have loved to be there longer. The staff makes an effort of remembering your name (like in all FS's) and smiles all the time (seemingly genuinly).
reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the usual Four Seasons high standards

likes.liked: — The location, superdeep bath and generous toiletries.
likes.disliked: — Trying to make the reservation in the first place was such hard work. Rooms were disappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location and excellent food. Very nice rooms with high quality furniture and finishing. Large pool with good service.
reviews.title: FS Bliss in the middle of Crazyness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a great time staying 3 nights at Four Seasons Bangkok. The hotel location was good few minutes walk from the skytrain. The area wasn't too busy or crazy for Bangkok. But still, the hotel was walking distance from shopping area and it was convenient.
reviews.title: Great service & amazing breakfast
Fantastic stay at Four Seasons
reviews.text: The hotel service was excellent at check-in, afternoon tea and breakfast. Everyone was smiling and attentive. The room was roomy and very comfortable with a separate shower room and a huge bath tub in the bathroom.
Additionally, the hotel's breakfast buffet was amazing. Best buffet breakfast ever! The food was excellent, the selection of food was excellent, and the restaurant was roomy and nice as well.
reviews.title: A good hotel for a conference

reviews.text: I will definitely stay at the hotel again. Oh, the spa at the hotel was great too.
reviews.title: Impeccable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Four Seasons last week with my partner where he was holding a conference. This has to be one of the best hotels we've stayed in for service in Asia. The staff are wonderful - so friendly and helpful but in a genuine way. From the concierge to the maid coming to do the turn down service they provide an impeccable service.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay
True luxury!
reviews.text: Four Seasons Hotel captures centuries of aristocracy and has created luxurious living for its guests! As we entered the lobby, I soaked in the grandeur of the lavish interiors and the elaborate decor. The turqoise and the velvety-greys of the sitting area were really classy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And wow! Our room was the one of the largest I've ever stayed in. To add to that, there was an additional wardrobe area, too. Even the washroom matched the rest of the grandeur, and I knew that this would be a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Great city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a day's shopping, when we got back to our room, we were in for a pleasant surprise. Though there had already been an exotic fruit platter (not the 2 mundane apples and 2 tired looking bananas) in our room at check-in, this time there was a dessert trolley, an arrangement of flowers, and a birthday card signed by the hotel staff, for my husband, since it was his birthday.
reviews.title: Dated and Disappointing Service

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet setting was amongst truly amazing surroundings, water bodies, a bridge, and tropical plants and fish. Breakfast in itself was pretty elaborate and interesting, too!
reviews.title: 3 great nights here

reviews.text: Later on in the day, I had Thai curry, and grilled fish while in the lobby sitting area, and I loved both the dishes. Totally recommended!
reviews.title: whatever you would expect from a four seasons, is what you get and more,,

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights second week of Jan. The overall impression of this hotel is very good.
reviews.title: Keep up to it's brand name

reviews.text: The spa is absolutely wonderful and the ambience of the place is also very well done.
reviews.title: Charming room

reviews.text: The location is near sky rail station and within walking distance to the shopping areas.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite and it was very big in size and the toilet is very well equipped.
reviews.title: Sticker shock

reviews.text: The only disappointment was the pool. The outdoor pool was so so and a lot smaller than I expected.
reviews.title: Great hotel but very noisy in the courtyard rooms

reviews.text: This was my first trip to Asia. The hotel is in a good spot, easy to access the train, good shopping close by and the property is very well appointed. The atrium set up of the building is nice (not sure how it would be in the rain). The food was amazing! We had dinner one night and had ordered multiple items think the portion size would be on the smaller end because the prices were so low and the portions ended up being very large and we had way too much food but it was all delicious. (Even tried the durian ice cream which was a little scary)
reviews.title: First stop in Asia

reviews.text: Fromt he moment you descend from the car and hear the water fountains, you are in a haven of welcome, 2 blocks from the very cenbter of Bangkok. The rooms ar furnished tastefully in an Asian mode, theya re spacious and comfortable-- and quiet. The service is spectacular. The Spice Garden is one of the best Thai restaurants in Bangkok. Room service is impeccable and rapid. The spaciouos pool garden is such a wonderful place to be, and indeed to lunch. High tea and cocktails in the lobby are very popular with prominent locals as well as guests. Everything about this hotel speaks of good management and pleasure. For convenience, there really is none better.
reviews.title: Just the Best

reviews.text: just completed a 4 day stay at this hotel for a corporate event. the hotel offered great clean facilities, good varied food and most importantly wonderful attentive service. the event facilities ticked like a clock and offered good AV, good refreshments and punctual service
reviews.title: Great Service during Corp. event

reviews.text: Very good hotel located right next to the sky train station. Service is great, rooms are comfortable, you get different fresh fruits every day and the pool is big enough for a real swim. We were a bit disappointed to find out there are no tennis courts.
reviews.title: Very nice with good service

reviews.text: we stayed 2 night at four season hotel bangkok with our 4 kids they gave us 2 connecting rooms for our kids and and a junior suite for us,beautiful hotel the location is convenient,our kids love the breakfast buffet as they have the 10 different stations where you can have from western to asian food,the service in this hotel is truly amazing!
reviews.title: 5 star on service

reviews.text: What can I say? I loved the Four Seasons before for its excellent location, charming ambience and impeccable service.
reviews.title: Not what it once was

reviews.text: 1- There is not much to complain about in terms of the location, except perhaps that the the nearby Hyatt and St Regis offer even more convenient access to the Skytrain. One issue to consider for leisure travel is that the location on one of Bangkok's highest end strips is actually an impediment to enjoying BKK's famous street food scene, small shops and restaurants, etc., but I knew what I was getting.
reviews.title: outstanding - extraordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. I still find the Four Seasons' old-style ambience to be extremely appealing, but compared to the St. Regis (same owner) next door, which I found to be overly sterile, it is inferior in nearly every other respect (room size and condition, views, service, views, etc.).
reviews.title: Lacking in some aspects

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. The biggest complaint I have is that the service and overall experience did not live up to the Four Seasons brand promise. Obviously, for a 30 year hotel, I can't expect the hardware to compete with newer properties. However, I would expect that to be compensated for in other areas. Check in was slow, there was one party checking out and two parties trying to check in at around 1pm and only one person at the front desk. The wait was long. The wait for luggage to be delivered to our room was also quite long. This is unacceptable for a Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.text: 4. Breakfast was crowded and service suffered as a result. My wife had to ask for tea thee times before it was delivered, food quality had deteriorated since my previous stay over a year ago and items were not replenished quickly enough. Coffee was terrible.
reviews.title: Feel like a home

reviews.text: Chose the Four Seasons for an all girl partying-relaxing night out due to its location. Great service, quiet rooms, nice big beds and fantastic linens. Nice thai decor with thai ancient style artistic renderings on the headboard. Bathrooms were also very well stocked with L'Occitane toiletries (important for us girls) and spacious enough for all of us to put our make up on at the same time.
reviews.title: We loved the Four Seasons

likes.liked: — Attention to detail which showed in decor, service, everything!

reviews.text: Fantastic stay, highly recommended!
reviews.title: Top Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotels that I have stayed in. Service is excellent like most 5 star hotels in Thailand. I was here for 5 nights and it was exceptionally good in all aspects. Rooms were huge and very clean.
reviews.title: Stylish Stay

reviews.text: Very good choice of restaurants, fantastic location, walkable distance to shopping centres, etc. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. I have stayed in a few of the well known hotel brands in Bangkok but this one would definitely be my first choice.
reviews.title: Everything you expect

reviews.text: We will officially make the Four Seasons Bangkok our official hotel on return trips to Thailand. Service was outstanding from the moment our S Class Mercedes picked us up at the airport. While everyone else was looking frantic while they tried to navigate BKK's airport transfers, ours was seamless. We were met by a Four Seasons rep who then had the Mercedes brought around. After 39 hours in transit, the fully adjustable seats, ice cold bottles of water, lemongrass scented cold towels and hard candies were truly appreciated.
reviews.title: Marvellous service at the Four Seasons

likes.liked: — Service and the size of the room
